snippet: Mr. Marshall was asked by Pete Townshend to make something “bigger and louder,” and generations of guitarists have bought it.
abstract: Jim Marshall, who made rock 'n' roll louder by inventing the amplifier that helped define guitarists from Jimi Hendrix to countless garage bands, dies at age 88.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Marshall was asked by Pete Townshend to make something “bigger and louder,” and generations of guitarists have bought it.

headline.seo: Jim Marshall, 88, Maker of Famed Fuzzy Amplifiers, Is Dead
headline.main: Jim Marshall, Maker of Famed Fuzzy Amplifiers, Dies at 88
